resources.string: In which state is Australia\'s highest waterfall?
What is Australia’s highest mainland mountain?
How many people out of total Australian population speak indigenous language?
Which of the following is Australia\'s longest river?
Where on the mainland is Australia\'s lowest point?
Approximately what percentage of mainland Australia is covered with desert?
By land mass, Australia is the _______ largest country in the world.
What is the biggest state in Australia?
What is the smallest state in Australia?
Which animal is on the Western Australia flag?
Australia has the world’s largest sand island. What is it called?
What is the name of this lake?
You are on Mt Tibrogargan, what state are you in?
Which river runs through Alice Springs?
Wallaman Falls is within the Wet Tropics World Heritage Area. Explore rainforest and enjoy spectacular gorge views on one of the short walking tracks near the falls.

Called by natives the “Kozzy” mountain, Mt Kosciuszko is the coldest part of Australia, and is covered in snow for months between June and October. This place includes the only skiing areas in Australia, and is well-developed for winter sports.

Having lived in Australia for at least 50,000 years, Indigenous Australians have one of the world\'s oldest living cultures. Many English words derive from Aboriginal languages, for example: barramundi, dingo, kangaroo, koala and wombat.
The Murray is the third longest navigable river in the world! It comes after the Amazon and the Nile. How amazing is that?

Lake Eyre (Kati Thanda) is a large, usually dry salt pan in the South Australian Outback and is considered to be the lowest point of the country (15m below sea level). It is the world\'s greatest salt lake and Australia\'s largest inland lake which comprises 400 million tonnes of salt. When it fills with water, it becomes a major tourist attraction and a heaven for birdlife.
